open_ftp.note: FTP service discovered and appears to accept connections.
open_ftp.recommendation: Disable FTP or restrict access; use SFTP/FTPS instead.

anonymous_ftp.note: Anonymous FTP access allowed — files may be uploaded/downloaded anonymously.
anonymous_ftp.recommendation: Disable anonymous login; require authenticated access and audit files.

ftp_server.note: General FTP server found (cleartext credentials risk).
ftp_server.recommendation: Replace with secure transfer (SFTP/FTPS) and enforce strong auth.

rdp_enabled.note: RDP service exposed — high-value target for lateral movement.
rdp_enabled.recommendation: Restrict RDP via firewall/VPN; enforce NLA and MFA for users.

rdp_nla_missing.note: RDP without Network Level Authentication (NLA) is enabled.
rdp_nla_missing.recommendation: Enable NLA and require updated RDP clients to reduce pre-auth risks.

smb_v1.note: SMBv1 detected — legacy protocol with known critical vulnerabilities (e.g., EternalBlue).
smb_v1.recommendation: Disable SMBv1 immediately; migrate to SMBv2/3 and patch systems.

smb_anonymous.note: SMB shares accessible anonymously or with weak permissions.
smb_anonymous.recommendation: Harden share ACLs; remove anonymous access; review file permissions.

smb_signing_disabled.note: SMB signing disabled — risk of man-in-the-middle tampering.
smb_signing_disabled.recommendation: Enable SMB signing and apply group policy controls.

netbios.note: NetBIOS/NetBT exposed — information leakage risk on network names/services.
netbios.recommendation: Limit exposure on WAN; block NetBIOS at network perimeter.

telnet.recommendation: Disable Telnet; use SSH and enforce strong keys/passwords.

smtp_open_relay.note: SMTP open relay detected — could be used for spam/abuse.
smtp_open_relay.recommendation: Disable relay for unauthenticated users; enforce auth and ACLs.

smtp_starttls_missing.note: SMTP server does not support STARTTLS — mails may be in clear text.
smtp_starttls_missing.recommendation: Enable STARTTLS and enforce opportunistic TLS or MTA-STS where possible.

dns_zone_transfer.note: DNS zone transfer (AXFR) allowed — full zone data can be retrieved.
dns_zone_transfer.recommendation: Restrict AXFR to authorized IPs or disable zone transfers publicly.

dns_srv_misconfig.note: Suspicious or misconfigured DNS SRV records found.
dns_srv_misconfig.recommendation: Review SRV records and only publish necessary services.

sslv3_detected.note: SSLv3 protocol detected — insecure and deprecated (POODLE risk).
sslv3_detected.recommendation: Disable SSLv3; support TLS 1.2/1.3 only and update server configs.

tls1_0_detected.note: TLS 1.0 detected — deprecated and weak against modern attacks.
tls1_0_detected.recommendation: Disable TLS 1.0/1.1; prefer TLS 1.2+ or TLS 1.3.

weak_cipher_rc4.note: RC4 or other weak ciphers enabled in TLS configuration.
weak_cipher_rc4.recommendation: Remove RC4 and other weak ciphers from server configs.

weak_cipher_des.recommendation: Disable DES/3DES and use AES-GCM suites or ChaCha20-Poly1305.

weak_dh_params.note: Diffie-Hellman parameters are weak (small key size) — vulnerable to Logjam.
weak_dh_params.recommendation: Use strong DH parameters (2048+), prefer ECDHE, and update TLS stacks.

self_signed_cert.note: Self-signed certificate detected — trust & MITM risk.
self_signed_cert.recommendation: Replace with CA-signed certificates or internal PKI with trust controls.

expired_cert.note: SSL/TLS certificate expired — users may see errors and trust is broken.
expired_cert.recommendation: Renew the certificate and verify the full chain and SANs.

wildcard_cert.note: Wildcard certificate in use — broader impact if compromised.
wildcard_cert.recommendation: Consider limiting wildcard usage; rotate private keys and monitor usage.

cert_name_mismatch.note: Certificate common name or SAN does not match host name.
cert_name_mismatch.recommendation: Issue correct certificates for each host or include proper SANs.

hsts_missing.note: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header missing.
hsts_missing.recommendation: Enable HSTS with an appropriate max-age and preload considerations.

csp_missing.note: Content-Security-Policy header absent — XSS mitigation weakened.
csp_missing.recommendation: Define and deploy a strict CSP appropriate for the application.

x_frame_options_missing.recommendation: Add X-Frame-Options or CSP frame-ancestors to prevent framing.

x_content_type_options_missing.note: X-Content-Type-Options header missing — MIME sniffing risk.

nosniff_missing.note: Response headers do not include nosniff directive.
nosniff_missing.recommendation: Add 'X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff' to reduce content sniffing.

secure_cookie_missing.note: Cookies missing Secure flag — may be sent over HTTP.
secure_cookie_missing.recommendation: Set 'Secure' on cookies to ensure transmission only over TLS.

samesite_missing.note: Cookies do not specify SameSite attribute — CSRF risk.
samesite_missing.recommendation: Set SameSite to Lax or Strict where applicable.

cors_wildcard.note: CORS configured with wildcard '*' — allows any origin.
cors_wildcard.recommendation: Restrict allowed origins to specific trusted domains.

cors_allow_credentials.note: CORS allows credentials and uses permissive origin — sensitive data risk.
cors_allow_credentials.recommendation: Do not combine Access-Control-Allow-Credentials with wildcard origin.

http_methods_insecure.note: HTTP methods like PUT/DELETE/TRACE/OPTIONS appear allowed and may be risky.
http_methods_insecure.recommendation: Disable unsafe methods unless required and audit each one.

directory_traversal_evidence.note: Evidence of directory traversal or path disclosure in responses.
directory_traversal_evidence.recommendation: Fix input sanitization and validate file path operations server-side.

public_git.note: Public /.git or Git metadata exposed — source code and secrets risk.
public_git.recommendation: Remove .git from webroot and audit repository for leaked secrets.

exposed_git_config.note: .git/config or .git/HEAD files accessible — repository info leaked.
exposed_git_config.recommendation: Remove or restrict access to Git metadata on production servers.

exposed_env.note: .env or environment config file exposed — secrets may be leaked.
exposed_env.recommendation: Remove .env from public webroot; rotate any leaked keys immediately.

exposed_htpasswd.recommendation: Move auth files outside webroot and use proper access controls.

backup_files_found.note: Backup or dump files (.bak, .sql, .zip) found in webroots.
backup_files_found.recommendation: Remove backups from public paths and store encrypted backups offsite.

sitemap_disclosure.note: sitemap.xml found — may reveal sensitive endpoints.
sitemap_disclosure.recommendation: Review sitemap contents and exclude sensitive internal URLs.

robots_sensitive_disclosure.note: robots.txt lists sensitive paths or admin URLs.
robots_sensitive_disclosure.recommendation: Avoid listing sensitive paths in robots; restrict access properly.

debug_mode_enabled.note: Debug / development mode appears enabled — verbose info leakage.
debug_mode_enabled.recommendation: Disable debug mode in production and audit logs for leaked data.

verbose_error_messages.note: Server error pages show stack traces or detailed info.
verbose_error_messages.recommendation: Return sanitized error messages; log details server-side only.

sql_error_messages.note: SQL errors present in output — can reveal DB structure.
sql_error_messages.recommendation: Handle DB errors gracefully and avoid exposing raw SQL in responses.

idor_possible.note: Patterns suggesting Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR) found.
idor_possible.recommendation: Implement authorization checks on object access and use opaque IDs.

insecure_file_upload.note: File upload endpoints accept unvalidated files — potential RCE or defacement.
insecure_file_upload.recommendation: Validate file types, apply virus scanning, and store uploads outside webroot.

insecure_deserialization.note: Signs of insecure deserialization or eval-like constructs detected.
insecure_deserialization.recommendation: Avoid unsafe deserialization; use safe parsers and validate inputs.

xxe_detected.note: Evidence of XML External Entity (XXE) processing in responses.
xxe_detected.recommendation: Disable external entity resolution and validate/parsing libraries.

clickjacking_possible.note: No protections detected; pages may be framed by other sites.
clickjacking_possible.recommendation: Add X-Frame-Options or CSP frame-ancestors to prevent framing.
